answers.author: Roy Witherow
answers.text:
The Village of Lake Zurich, Illinois, merged its Building & Zoning Department and Public Works Department into a new Community Services Department.  We were not aware of any how-to guide regarding the process, and relied on some heavy lifting by senior staff.  We are currently in our second year of the new structure, and it is working well.  I would be happy to discuss the issues with you at your convenience.

answers.text:
Hi Michael,
So I found a document on the Knowledge Network that provides recommendations for the merging of police and fire departments. The recommendations about what to do during the transitional period may be helpful for you.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/document/302136/Report_and_Recommendations_regarding_a_new_Organizational_Structure_for_the_Police_and_Fire_Departme
Hope this helped.
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

author: Michael Dutton
text: We are looking to merge a number of departments - some as small as one person - into a Department of Public Works.  Has anyone found a good how-to guide covering the work that has to be done during a transition?
title: Transitioning to a DPW
